topic.title: Is there interest in a non-Javascript version of ZeroNet?
topic.body: The down-side is that much of the functionality would have to be implemented in Python instead :-)

1561776860_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
>wget -c --no-check-certificate -e http_proxy=127.0.0.1:9050 https://notabug.org/crimeflare/cloudflare-tor/archive/master.tar.gz

I'm sorry but

>-e http_proxy=127.0.0.1:9050

won't use the Tor proxy, Tor doesn't even have a HTTP proxy built-in.

> [pineapples](#comment_68_19XCfah7iuo9zYqk7GoTDXVNp4p5BpEH1T):  there is nothing wrong with cloudflare.

Don't dismiss everything someone says because you don't like or trust the person. Just visit https://notabug.org/crimeflare/cloudflare-tor it explains what's wrong with Cloudflare, it's a Man-In-The-Middle proxy

>In short, for a few years now, I've been wondering how To Filter the wheat from the chaff, and I've found it:

So your solution is to block Cloudflare? I don't think that fixes the problem, regardless it's easier to block Cloudflare's IP ranges instead of all the domain names.

https://www.cloudflare.com/ips/

1561690274_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_364_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): don't say "us" when you can't say I

Come on how many times have you said "we" now?

1561670972_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
> [pineapples](#comment_71_19XCfah7iuo9zYqk7GoTDXVNp4p5BpEH1T): you are listening to me tho ;)

To be fair he said:

>Don't worry no one is listening to you.

Maybe he's admitting here he's not a real person. Though I'm listening to you at least :)
